data.title: Adds some bake-to-collada functions
data.body:
Makes it so prefabs can correctly 'export to collada' by running the buildPolyList function on it's children.

Also adds a 'Bake Selection to Mesh' option to the tools menu in the editor to export the selected mesh to a collada file, and then replaces the selection with a TSStatic.

data.title: remove dml file
data.body: remove rain.dml file

data.title: Change VS to use the default fp:precise
data.body: Turns out Visual Studio 2015 is doing some aggressive optimizations that where not present in older versions of Visual Studio. Using fp:fast is causing slight floating point inaccuracies that eventually filter down and we end up getting rotations that are wrong and causing havoc when saving mission files. Changed the setting back to the default fp:precise

data.title: GL vsync fix
data.body: Various fixes for OpenGL vsync support

data.title: [workaround] pinches parallax steps so the 0-1 range has minimal artifacting
factoring in tangentW causes parallax to swap specular highlight directions.
data.body: removed that, as well as a prior attempted workaround.

data.title: Fix SDL/Mac report going into the background
data.body: Needed a false in there, and a very useless #ifdef

data.title: bool PlatformWindowSDL::isFocused() wasn't returning false ever
space and enter do not work in gui editor
data.body: It seems that the space and enter keys are not accepted when typing texts for a GuiMLTextCtrl or a GuiButtonCtrl in the inspector of the gui editor.

data.title: Update version.h
Shadow quality change on Zooming
data.body:
When you press zoom the shadow quality changes causing the shadows to fizzle and changing density, depending on quality settings and shadow resolution.
Example unzoomed:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_DesertRuins_day_001-0000.png
And zoomed:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_DesertRuins_day_001-0001.png

I'm using 512 texture size with shadow distance set to 400 and using my "low" lighting quality setting, which modifies the quality by additional 0.5.
This is not a serious issue as it is mostly noticeable on low quality settings, so it is not urgent, but is a bit of a visual flaw and can get pretty obvious on very low quality settings.

This may be related to the ugly fizzle fade the shadows use and may improve with a proper smooth blending.
Disabling the shadow changing quality may have other issues, since when you then zoom on something in the distance, the shadows will keep low quality, but the advantage of this would be, you would not see the shadows magically morphing into a more dense version.

data.title: [WIP] Update the C-Interface
data.body:
This PR includes mainly 4 things:

* A clean-up of some existing console functions, with incorrect information in ConsoleDoc and incorrect types
* Update the ConsoleDoc dump, to provide some more information
* Fix existing C-Interface, and cleanup some inconsistencies
* Add some more C-Interface functionality, like hooks from engine to interface.

(This has nothing to do with C#, this is a general fix and improvement of existing Torque3D functionality)

data.title: FIELD_ComponentInspectors inspector hook up
data.body: Fills out the automaticly filled inspector entries for AbstractClassRep::FieldFlags::FIELD_ComponentInspectors with a pressable button.

data.title: directional coloration for pathnodes,
data.body: as well as enlarges both the look and 'physical' handle size for ease of use.

data.title: re-enable face culling for the terrain
data.body: This just re-enables face culling for the terrain that was disabled when deferred shading replaced deferred lighting.

data.title: Big lag spikes with parallax on terrain since 3.9
data.body:
I noticed a significant loss in fps count since 3.9 when I activated parallax on terrain.
In a scene where I got 60fps (with V-sync) it drops down as low as 30fps sometimes, especially when turning around quickly or zooming to somewhere, resulting in a clearly noticeable lag.
Turning off V-sync helps a bit, but there are still significant lag spikes.
In my latest stable build which is based on 3.8 there is no noticeable lag spike when parallax on terrain is on, the fps stay at a stable 60fps with V-sync as it is supposed to be.
This is weird since 3.9 runs overall faster, but when activating parallax on terrain it is overall much slower. I'm aware that parallax is very heavy, but it never used up that much performance, maybe 10-20% at max before and without lag spikes, but now it eats up to 50% performance with heavy lag spikes.

data.title: motion based updates for shadow caching
data.body:
adds a $pref::Shadows::teleportDis and $pref::Shadows::turnRate (defaults 4, and 1 respectively)
if either is exceeded during a given frame, shadow chaches are forced to refresh themselves.

data.title: Adds some helpful utility math functions.
Also adds a sanity check in the event a splash image isn't found.
data.body: Also adds a sanity check in the event a splash image isn't found.

data.title: Better checking for redundant FBO binding with Glad
data.body:
A minor issue with the Glad implementation was that on Windows machines with intel graphics, it would trip openGL warns about redundant FBO bindings which may have a theoretical performance impact. 

We didn't find enough of an impact to be concerned, and no other GPU/platform exhibited this behavior, so we just squelched the warn for now, but a revisit of the FBO binding code at some point wouldn't be a bad idea.

data.title: Separate timing event for NavMesh updating
data.body: Per comment in #1830 having a separate timing event for updating UI elements and whatnot wouldn't be a bad idea.

data.title: fix ColladaExporter
data.body:
Remove old colladamax format, fixed up bad coordinates, added new collada format, valid against the COLLADA 1.4.1 schema, added to load textures and UVs.

Test it! [ T3D_ColladaExporter (15MB)](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9GUwtDHCp_eYlpuZHQ1aEhGRmM) Thanks!

Open Issue: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/467

data.title: Fix  for NavPath is not updated when navMesh has change.
Adding depth option to the texture of guiOffscreenCanvas
fix issue #696
data.body: fix https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/696

data.title: Torque build in video capture extremely slow
data.body:
The build in video capture function slows down the game extremely, like reduces the FPS from 80 to 10 when switching recording on.
Someone told me this is likely to the encoding not being shifted to another CPU core.
This is not a serious problem, but it may be a nice feature to have, if someone knows a quick fix.
At least the videos play smooth after they have been recorded in slowmotion.

data.title: sdlPlatformGL.cpp fails when OpenGL is not added in CMake
data.body:
Hey guys,

I just tried compiling the engine with SDL and DX11 turned on. When I tried to compile it, I got an error in sdlPlatformGL.cpp, where it tries to call the following function: `epoxy_handle_external_wglMakeCurrent` which is undefined.
If I also enable OpenGL, then it works.

So, is this an issue or is SDL dependent on OpenGL?

data.title: Hides the light's dynamic refresh rate field in the editor
data.body: Hides the light's dynamic refresh rate field to avoid confusion, leaving only the static refresh rate field to be edited in reference to #1707

data.title: Selecting Windows does not bring them to the front
data.body:
When you select GUI windows, they are supposed to be moved to the front as seen here in the source code:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gui/containers/guiWindowCtrl.cpp#L736
But this does not work currently.
To reproduce this issue you need two GUI windows on the screen and both with "GuiModelessDialogProfile" since this does not block the other GUIs. I used:
Canvas.pushDialog( OptionsDlg ); and Canvas.pushDialog(PostFXManager); in console, you have to set the OptionsDlg to "GuiModelessDialogProfile" before.
Then you bring one window in front of the other and select the window behind and you will see that it will not be brought to the front, which it is supposed to do.
